ai-tha-ap391:1.3_0: the four quarters of the Saṅgha:
ai-tha-ap391:2.1_0: At the time of the Buddha Peaceful,
ai-tha-ap391:2.3_0: joyful intent on what is beneficial,
ai-tha-ap391:3.1_0: The Buddhas will be awakened for themselves,
ai-tha-ap391:3.2_0: I would have gained the going forth,
ai-tha-ap391:4.1_0: and because of that bright root:
ai-tha-ap391:4.2_0: like a transmigrated in a river.
ai-tha-ap391:4.3_0: When they become a god or human,
ai-tha-ap391:5.1_0: Through the remainder of that deed,
ai-tha-ap391:5.2_0: here in the last existence of existence,
ai-tha-ap391:5.3_0: But at Campā on the best of men,
ai-tha-ap391:5.4_0: I was born in a child,
ai-tha-ap391:6.2_0: his father had given to me.
ai-tha-ap391:6.3_0: I give to you the boy.
ai-tha-ap391:7.2_0: and both those born in the feet,
ai-tha-ap391:8.2_0: This is the one thing and the other.
ai-tha-ap391:9.1_0: I was awakened to the Buddha,
ai-tha-ap391:10.3_0: I am perfected, my defilements ended.
ai-tha-ap391:11.3_0: I’m not aware of any living being
ai-tha-ap391:11.4_0: as is the fruit for giving.
ai-tha-ap391:13.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap391:15.2_0: at the head of the Community of monks.
ai-tha-ap391:15.3_0: asked a question, and he answered the questions.
ai-tha-ap391:16.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Soṇa.
